g.text: 1. Before I suppose that context could be fulfilled using stack, because
the top of stack is the place where providers store. That's true, however
we have already the owner or component tree. any one of branch of that tree
could work as a stack, so it's unnecessary to involve another stack,
simply put providers created on each corresponding owner or component node.
For betterment, avoiding search up till end of that owner or component tree,
using providers from parent node override nodes with same type in the child
node is a high performant way, as `useContext` always pick the latest one.
